title: Allow consumer to override default send timeout duration
body:
Fixes #51 

# Before
The duration after which a `put_metric_data` call is considered failed is hardcoded to 4 seconds. This can be problematic on e.g. a slow network connection, leading to a high rate of send timeouts.

## After 
The consumer can call a new `send_timeout_secs` function on the Builder in order to customise this value.

I have tested this feature by installing this branch in project which uses `metrics_cloudwatch`.

title: Changes API so that the AWS Cloudwatch client is supplied when starting the metrics.
body: This hides the CloudWatch trait from end users, and enables them to easily customize the Cloudwatch client object before starting the server. The builder is also non-async right until the service is started, and we avoid some vtable overhead as we don't need `Box<dyn Cloudwatch>` anymore.

title: switch rusoto to aws_sdk_cloudwatch
body:
switch over to aws-sdk as rusoto is no longer updated.
new limits for number of metrics, etc, from [the docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/APIReference/API_PutMetricData.html) (at the time of writing, at least)

Since the aws-sdk uses a concrete `Client` type rather than rusoto's `Cloudwatch` trait, i had to wrap it in a trait to allow mocking and test.  this does mean that technically clients could still use a rusoto client if they take care to adjust the types.

title: Fix the benchmark and some minor tweaks
body: Reverts https://github.com/ramn/metrics_cloudwatch/pull/29 since it inevitably slows down shutdown which is problematic. An intermediary commit fixed the issue in the benchmarks but I think it is better to just not do it at all.

title: feat: Update the metrics crate to 0.15
body:
BREAKING CHANGE

Users should update their metrics version to 0.15 or metrics will not be
reported

title: fix: Spread each metrics batch out to reduce throttling
body:
By calculating how many requests we need and evenly spreading those
requests out over the first half of the send interval (so we still send
the metrics fairly quickly), we should reduce the risk of throttling due
to bursting the requests to quickly after one another.

title: feat: Allow the metric channel's buffer size to be configured
fix: Retry the metrics sending it gets throttled
Amortize the cost of the timestamps
body: When we can read multiple datums in a short interval we do not need to retrieve the timestamp for every datum. Instead we can batch them to significantly cut the cost of this.

title: feat: Allow default dimensions to be removed for specific metrics
feat: Allow rustls to be used over native-tls
fix: Make gauges display the current value as "Average"
body:
With multiple tasks submitting to the same gauge the `Average` would
then be the average of the tasks which is probably the best we can do.

Alternatively we could record `sample_count` and submit `sum: sample_count *
current` but it probably makes more sense to get one "sample" per task,
instead of one sample per call to `gauge!` (?)

title: feat: Update to metrics 0.13
body:
Since metrics 0.13 now support sending increment and decrement to
gauges, the "sum" in `StatisticSet` now tracks the current value as the
sum does no longer make any sense (it didn't really make sense before
either).
